_components.wordtips: A quiet place to work helps get homework done.

Television can be fun, but not during work time.
A phone call can stop homework in its tracks.
A to-do list can help you organize your homework time.
Use a timer to tell you when to take a short break.
Hurrying through your homework doesn't help anything!
Doing homework in a timely manner is your responsibility.
Good time management will make homework a breeze.
Don't let anything get in the way of your homework.
Being a good student takes practice.
Do your homework in a Quiet place with a To-do list.
When you listen, it's hard to get distracted.
Thinking of questions to ask helps you listen.
Keeping eye contact helps you focus on what is being said.</feedback> </item>
Focus on what matters, not distractions.
Class is not an appropriate place for daydreaming.
Sitting up straight helps keep your attention focused.
Taking notes can help you pay attention.
A lot of bad habits can lead to poor time management.
As a student, it's your responsibility to do your homework.
Music can be a big distraction, especially when it's loud.

Sit up straight to keep your mind from wandering.
